name: St. Gregory the Illuminator

locations.description: Apostle to Armenia, first Catholicos of Armenia

summary: Gregory the Illuminator was the founder and first Catholicos (head) of the Armenian Apostolic Church. He converted King Tiridates III of Armenia to Christianity, making Armenia the first nation to adopt Christianity as its state religion in 301 AD. He established the Armenian Church and is considered the patron saint of Armenia. His work laid the foundation for Christianity in the Caucasus region.
